If you think the changes up on the PBE are them gutting Sejuani, I'm curious what you would call what Riot did to Lee Sin's competition a while ago (namely, Kha'Zix and Elise).

Seriously, Sejuani is still going to be strong after these changes, and it wouldn't surprise me if she still continued to have the highest winrate afterwards as well. Hell, Sejuani is probably still going to be better than Lee Sin after these changes pretty much everywhere that's not competitive play. She's a huge outlier right now - she has both a high winrate, high pickrate, and a steadily escalating banrate across all ELOs and across all regions. That's a pretty good indicator that a champion is legitimately and undoubtedly overpowered. 

Even if Sejuani were to somehow be completely and utterly annihilated by these lovetap changes, the jungle would still be several times more diverse than it used to be. Now you can jungle Nautilus, Volibear, Amumu, Sion, Cho'Gath, and Skarner in addition to the previously viable junglers, which is over double what the jungle champion pool was previously (Lee Sin, Jarvan, Vi, Rek'Sai) even without Sejuani. Lee Sin isn't even close to being a top tier jungler right now - his kit is still grotesquely overloaded, but I'd say until his hopefully inevitable rework, he's fairly under control.

Veigar is undertuned and I'm thankful Riot is still watching and working on him.  His Q is awesome, his E is a lot healthier, but still needs work and his W is in need of a major overhaul.  All in all, Veigar is on his way to being a much better champ than he ever was, Riot just needs to keep on working on the E and W interaction.
